cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay on body language focuses on body language as its main topic.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document, text, or discourse takes the object as its main topic or subject matter.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss the use of body language across various situations.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss how body language affects relationships.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.
args.justification: All three relations link the same subject document ('essay on body language') to topics it discusses, so they share the same aboutness semantics. For consistency, the first relation should use the same relation class ('document_subject_relation') and group ('ABOUTNESS') as the others, and align the canonical description to a single reusable definition.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations link the same subject document ('essay on body language') to topics it discusses, so they share the same aboutness semantics. For consistency, the first relation should use the same relation class ('document_subject_relation') and group ('ABOUTNESS') as the others, and align the canonical description to a single reusable definition.
